tit.e: Southern Dynasty(Japan)
The Southern Dynasty (Japan)
The Southern Court (Japan)

sen.j: 南朝（なんちょう）は、吉野朝廷（よしのちょうてい）とも称され、南北朝時代 (日本)に京都以南の大和国の吉野（奈良県吉野郡吉野町）、賀名生（同県五條市西吉野町）、摂津国の住吉行宮（大阪府大阪市住吉区）を本拠とした大覚寺統の後醍醐天皇に属する朝廷。
sen.e: The Southern Dynasty is also called the Yoshino Court and is the court belonging to Emperor Godaigo of the Daikaku-ji Temple line established in the period of Northern and Southern Dynasties and based in the Yoshino (present day Yoshino Town, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture), Ano (present day Nishiyoshino Town, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture) in the province of Yamato, south of Kyoto, Sumiyoshi-angu (Sumiyoshi Ward, Osaka City, Psaka Prefecture) in the province of Settsu.

The Southern Dynasty is also called the Yoshino Court and was the court belonging to Emperor Godaigo of the Daikaku-ji Temple line established in the period of Northern and Southern Dynasties and based in the Yoshino (present day Yoshino Town, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture), Ano (present day Nishiyoshino Town, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture) in the province of Yamato, south of Kyoto, Sumiyoshi-angu (Sumiyoshi Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture) in the province of Settsu.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。（時制とスペルミス）
sen.e: The Southern Court is also called the Yoshino Court and was the court belonging to Emperor Godaigo of the Daikaku-ji Temple line established in the period of Northern and Southern Courts and based in the Yoshino (present day Yoshino Town, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture), Ano (present day Nishiyoshino Town, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture) in the province of Yamato, south of Kyoto, Sumiyoshi-angu (Sumiyoshi Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture) in the province of Settsu.

sen.j: ちなみに、大覚寺統の嫡流は後二条天皇の皇胤である木寺宮家である。
sen.e: The lineage of the eldest son of the Daikaku-ji Temple line is the imperial descendants of Emperor Gonijo, the Kideranomiya family.
The lineage of the eldest son of the Daikaku-ji Temple line is that of the imperial descendants of Emperor Gonijo, the Kideranomiya family.
The lineage of the eldest son of the Daikaku-ji Temple line is that of the imperial descendants of Emperor Gonijo, the Kideranomiya family.

sen.j: 1336年から1392年まで56年あまり存続し、叙位や元号の制定など政権としての機能を有した。
sen.e: The dynasty lasted around 56 years from 1336 to 1392 and had a government system with the conferment of court rank and era name.
The dynasty lasted around 56 years from 1336 to 1392 and had a government system with the conferment of court rank and era name.
The dynasty lasted around 56 years from 1336 to 1392 and had a government system with the conferment of court rank and era name.

tit.j: 建武政権の瓦解と北朝の成立
tit.e: Debacle of the Kenmu Government and Establishment of the Northern Dynasty
Debacle of the Kenmu Government and Establishment of the Northern Dynasty
Debacle of the Kenmu Government and Establishment of the Northern Court

sen.j: 鎌倉時代に皇統は後深草系統の持明院統と亀山系統の大覚寺統のふたつに分裂する両統迭立が起こる。
sen.e: The Kamakura Period saw the Imperial line split into two, the Jimyo-in line of Emperor Gofukasa's lineage, and the Daikaku-ji line of Emperor Kameyama's lineage, and this situation is called "Ryoto Tetsuritsu".

The Kamakura Period saw the Imperial line split into two, the Jimyo-in line of Emperor Gofukasa's lineage, and the Daikaku-ji line of Emperor Kameyama's lineage, and this situation is called "Ryoto Tetsuritsu".

The Kamakura period saw the Imperial line split into two, the Jimyoin line of Emperor Gofukasa's lineage, and the Daikakuji line of Emperor Kameyama's lineage, and this situation is called "Ryoto Tetsuritsu."
sen.cmt: period小文字にしました。ハイフン削除。”を"に訂正しました。

sen.j: 両統は皇位を争奪し、鎌倉幕府が仲裁していた。
sen.e: The two lines fought over the throne and the Kamakura Shogunate intervened.
The two lines fought over the throne and the Kamakura Shogunate intervened.
The two lines fought over the throne and the Kamakura Shogunate intervened.

sen.j: 文保2年（1318年）に践祚して親政を開始した大覚寺統の後醍醐天皇は倒幕計画を企て、1331年に三種の神器を持って笠置山へ入り挙兵すると、幕府の奏請により持明院統の光厳天皇が践祚される。
sen.e: In 1318, Emperor Godaigo of the Daikaku-ji line, who had ascended the throne and started a direct imperial rule, plotted to overthrow the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and when he carried away the Three Sacred Treasures to Kasagi-yama Mountain to raise forces in 1331, the bakufu petitioned for the ascension of Emperor Kogon of the Jimyo-in line.

In 1318, Emperor Godaigo of the Daikaku-ji line, who had ascended the throne and started a direct imperial rule, plotted to overthrow the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and when he carried away the Three Sacred Treasures to Kasagi-yama Mountain to raise forces in 1331, the bakufu petitioned for the ascension of Emperor Kogon of the Jimyo-in line.

In 1318, Emperor Godaigo of the Daikakuji line, who had ascended the throne and started a direct imperial rule, plotted to overthrow the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and when he carried away the Three Sacred Treasures to Kasagi-yama Mountain to raise forces in 1331, the bakufu petitioned for the ascension of Emperor Kogon of the Jimyoin line.

sen.j: 1333年、反幕勢力の結集により鎌倉幕府が滅亡すると後醍醐天皇は京へ戻り、光厳天皇と正慶年号を廃して建武の新政を開始する。
sen.e: When the Kamakura shogunate collapsed due to the united actions of anti-bakufu forces in 1333, Emperor Godaigo returned to Kyoto, abolished Emperor Kogon and the era name of Shokyo, and started the Kenmu Restoration.

When the Kamakura shogunate collapsed due to the united actions of anti-bakufu forces in 1333, Emperor Godaigo returned to Kyoto, abolished Emperor Kogon and the era name of Shokyo, and started the Kenmu Restoration.

When the Kamakura shogunate collapsed due to the united actions of anti-bakufu forces in 1333, Emperor Godaigo returned to Kyoto, abolished Emperor Kogon and the era name of Shokyo, and started the Kenmu Restoration.

sen.j: 1335年（建武 (日本)2年）、7月に関東で中先代の乱が起こると後醍醐天皇は討伐に向かった足利尊氏を黙認するが、乱を平定した尊氏は鎌倉に留まり建武政権から離反する。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo overlooked Takauji ASHIKAGA when he went to settle the Nakasendai Revolt that occurred in Kanto in July 1335, but Takauji remained in Kamakura after settling the revolt and left the Kenmu government.

Emperor Godaigo overlooked Takauji ASHIKAGA when he went to settle the Nakasendai Revolt that occurred in Kanto in July 1335, but Takauji remained in Kamakura after settling the revolt and left the Kenmu government.

Emperor Godaigo overlooked Takauji ASHIKAGA when he went to settle the Nakasendai Revolt that occurred in Kanto in July 1335, but Takauji remained in Kamakura after settling the revolt and left the Kenmu government.

sen.j: 宮方は京都に進撃してきた尊氏を撃破する。
sen.e: The Imperial forces defeated Takauji when he headed towards Kyoto.
The Imperial forces defeated Takauji when he headed towards Kyoto.
The Imperial forces defeated Takauji when he headed towards Kyoto.

sen.j: 翌1336年、九州落ちしていた尊氏は持明院統の光厳天皇から院宣を受けて再び東上する。
sen.e: The next year in 1336, Takauji is bestowed an Imperial command from Emperor Kogon of the Jimyo-in line while he was in hiding in Kyushu and he heads back east again.
The next year in 1336, Takauji was bestowed an Imperial command from Emperor Kogon of the Jimyo-in line while he was in hiding in Kyushu and he headed back east again.
The next year in 1336, Takauji was bestowed an Imperial command from Emperor Kogon of the Jimyoin line while he was in hiding in Kyushu and he headed back east again.

sen.j: 宮方では新田義貞、楠木正成らを迎撃に派遣するが、5月尊氏は湊川の戦いにおいて新田ら宮方を撃破して入京する。
sen.e: The Imperial forces send Yoshisada NITTA and Masashie KUSUNOKI to attack, but Takauji defeats Nitta's forces in May at the Battle of Minatogawa and enters Kyoto.
The Imperial forces sent Yoshisada NITTA and Masashie KUSUNOKI to attack, but Takauji defeated Nitta's forces in May at the Battle of Minatogawa and entered Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。（時制）
sen.e: The Imperial forces sent Yoshisada NITTA and Masashie KUSUNOKI to attack, but Takauji defeated Nitta's forces in May at the Battle of Minatogawa and entered Kyoto.

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇は叡山に逃れて抵抗するが、8月には光明天皇を践祚して北朝が成立し、11月に帰京した後醍醐天皇から三種の神器を接収した尊氏は京都に武家政権（のちの室町幕府）を成立させる。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo escapes to Ei-zan Mountain had continues to rebel, but in Emperor Koyo ascends the throne to start the Northern Dynasty in August, and Takauji, who retrieved the Three Sacred Treasures from Emperor Godaigo establishes a samurai government (later the Muromachi bakufu) in Kyoto.

Emperor Godaigo escaped to Ei-zan Mountain and continued to rebel, but Emperor Koyo ascended the throne in August and started the Northern Dynasty, and Takauji, who retrieved the Three Sacred Treasures from Emperor Godaigo, established a samurai government (later the Muromachi bakufu) in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。（時制）
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo escaped to Ei-zan Mountain and continued to rebel, but Emperor Koyo ascended the throne in August and started the Northern Court, and Takauji, who retrieved the Three Sacred Treasures from Emperor Godaigo who returned Kyoto in November, established a samurai government (later the Muromachi bakufu) in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。11月に帰京したを訳出しました。

tit.j: 南朝の成立と南北朝併立
tit.e: The Establishment of the Southern Dynasty and Concomitant Existence of Southern and Northern Dynasties.
The Establishment of the Southern Dynasty and Concomitant Existence of the Southern and Northern Dynasties.
The Establishment of the Southern Court and Concomitant Existence of the Southern and Northern Courts
tit.cmt: DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。ピリオド削除。

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇は京都を脱出して吉野へ逃れて朝廷を開き、光明天皇に渡した神器は偽物であると主張し、南北朝が成立する。
sen.e: The Northern and Southern Courts were established when Emperor Godaigo escaped Kyoto and fled to Yoshino, established a court and claimed that the sacred treasures that he gave to Emperor Komyo were fake.

The Northern and Southern Courts were established when Emperor Godaigo escaped Kyoto and fled to Yoshino, established a court and claimed that the sacred treasures that he gave to Emperor Komyo were fake.

The Northern and Southern Courts were established when Emperor Godaigo escaped Kyoto and fled to Yoshino, established a court and claimed that the sacred treasures that he gave to Emperor Komyo were fake.

sen.j: 以後、吉野の朝廷は南朝、京都の朝廷は北朝 (日本)と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Henceforth, the court in Yoshino is called the Southern Dynasty and the court in Kyoto is called the Northern Dynasty (Japan).
Henceforth, the court in Yoshino is called the Southern Dynasty and the court in Kyoto is called the Northern Dynasty (Japan).
Henceforth, the court in Yoshino is called the Southern Court and the court in Kyoto is called the Northern Court (Japan).

sen.j: 後醍醐は、新田義貞に恒良親王、尊良親王を奉じさせて北陸へ、懐良親王を九州へ派遣し、北畠親房は常陸国へ赴いて、それぞれ諸国で南朝勢力の結集を図る。
sen.e: Godaigo sent Yoshisada NITTA with Imperial Princes Tsuneyoshi and Takayoshi to Hokuriku, Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi to Kyushu, and Chikafusa KITABATAKE to the province of Hitachi to gather troops at each location for the Southern Dynasty.

Godaigo sent Yoshisada NITTA with Imperial Princes Tsuneyoshi and Takayoshi to Hokuriku, Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi to Kyushu, and Chikafusa KITABATAKE to the province of Hitachi to gather troops at each location for the Southern Dynasty.

Godaigo sent Yoshisada NITTA with Imperial Princes Tsuneyoshi and Takayoshi to Hokuriku, Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi to Kyushu, and Chikafusa KITABATAKE to the province of Hitachi to gather troops at each location for the Southern Court.

sen.j: 新田義貞、北畠顕家らはそれぞれ撃破されて戦死し、1339年（延元4年/暦応2年）には後醍醐が死去して後村上天皇が即位する。
sen.e: Yoshisada NITTA and Akiie KITABATAKE were both defeated and died in battle, and in 1339, Godaigo died and Emperor Gomurakami ascended the throne.
Yoshisada NITTA and Akiie KITABATAKE were both killed in battle, and in 1339, Godaigo died and Emperor Gomurakami ascended the throne.
Yoshisada NITTA and Akiie KITABATAKE were both killed in battle, and in 1339, Godaigo died and Emperor Gomurakami ascended the throne.

sen.j: 一方、尊氏は1338年（延元3年/暦応元年）に北朝から征夷大将軍に任じられる。
sen.e: On the other hand, Takauji is named Seiitaishogun (Commander of troops against the barbarians) in 1338 by the Northern Dynasty.
On the other hand, Takauji was named Seiitaishogun (Commander of troops against the barbarians) in 1338 by the Northern Dynasty.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。（時制）
sen.e: On the other hand, Takauji was named Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in 1338 by the Northern Court.
sen.cmt: 征夷大将軍→seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians")としました。DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。

sen.j: 後醍醐の死後は北畠親房などが南朝を指揮するが、1348年（正平 (日本)3年/貞和2年）には楠木正行らが四條畷の戦いにおいて足利方の高師直に敗北し、吉野に侵攻された南朝は賀名生へ移る。
sen.e: After Godaigo's death, Chikafusa KITABATAKE led the Southern Dynasty but in 1348, Masatsura KUSUNOKI and others lost to KO no Moronao of the Ashikaga forces at the Battle of Shijonawate, and the Southern Dynasty is transferred to Ano when Yoshino was attacked.

After Godaigo's death, Chikafusa KITABATAKE led the Southern Dynasty but in 1348, Masatsura KUSUNOKI and others lost to KO no Moronao of the Ashikaga forces at the Battle of Shijonawate, and the Southern Dynasty is transferred to Ano when Yoshino was attacked.

After Godaigo's death, Chikafusa KITABATAKE led the Southern Court but in 1348, Masatsura KUSUNOKI and others lost to KO no Moronao of the Ashikaga forces at the Battle of Shijonawate, and the Southern Court is transferred to Ano when Yoshino was attacked.

tit.j: 足利政権の分裂と正平一統
tit.e: The Division of the Ashikaga Government and Shohei itto
The Division of the Ashikaga Government and Shohei itto
The Division of the Ashikaga Government and Shohei Itto

sen.j: 足利政権では将軍尊氏や足利家執事の高師直と実質的政務を任された尊氏実弟の足利直義が対立し、やがて全国的な争乱に発展する観応の擾乱が起こり、これを契機に南朝は再び勢力を回復する。
sen.e: The Shogun Takauji and the Ashikaga family chamberlain KO no Moronao became antagonized with Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, who was in charge of the actual governance, leading to the Kanno Disturbance where a nation-wide battle broke out and due to this incident, the Southern Dynasty regains its power.

The Shogun Takauji and the Ashikaga family chamberlain KO no Moronao became antagonized by Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, who was in charge of the actual governance, leading to the Kanno Disturbance where a nation-wide battle broke out and due to this incident, the Southern Dynasty regained its power.

The Shogun Takauji and the Ashikaga family chamberlain KO no Moronao became antagonized by Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, who was in charge of the actual governance, leading to the Kanno Disturbance where a nation-wide battle broke out and due to this incident, the Southern Court regained its power.

sen.j: 1350年12月、師直のクーデターで失脚した直義は京都を脱出し、師直打倒の兵を募る。
sen.e: In December 1350, Tadayoshi lost power due to a coup d'etat by Moronao, and escaped Kyoto to gather troops to throw down Moronao.
In December 1350, Tadayoshi lost power due to a coup d'etat by Moronao, and escaped Kyoto to gather troops to bring down Moronao.
In December 1350, Tadayoshi lost power due to a coup d'etat by Moronao, and escaped Kyoto to gather troops to bring down Moronao.

sen.j: 北朝は直義討伐の院宣を下し、南朝は直義の帰服に応じる。
sen.e: The Northern Dynasty issues an imperial order to defeat Tadayoshi, and the Southern Dynasty answered Tadayoshi's call.
The Northern Dynasty issued an imperial order ordering the defeat of Tadayoshi, and the Southern Dynasty answered Tadayoshi's call.
The Northern Court issued an imperial order ordering the defeat of Tadayoshi, and the Southern Court answered Tadayoshi's call.

sen.j: 直義は師直を追い、さらに摂津で尊氏を撃破して和睦する。
sen.e: Tadayoshi chased Moronao and defeated Takauji at Settsu and they made their peace.
Tadayoshi chased Moronao and defeated Takauji at Settsu and they made their peace.
Tadayoshi chased Moronao and defeated Takauji at Settsu and they made their peace.

sen.j: 1351年（正平6年/観応2年）、巻き返しを図る尊氏が南朝に講和条件を出して和睦し、正平一統が成立して年号の統一が行われる。
sen.e: In 1351, aiming to recover power, Takauji reaches the conditions of peace with the Southern Dynasty and is reconciled, establishing the Shohei-itto and the era names are unified.
In 1351, aiming to recover power, Takauji reached peace with the Southern Dynasty and they were reconciled, establishing the Shohei-itto and unifying the era names.
In 1351, aiming to recover power, Takauji reached peace with the Southern Court they were reconciled, establishing the Shohei itto and unifying the era names.
sen.cmt: DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。表記統一のためハイフン削除。スペース補足。

sen.j: 尊氏は鎌倉で直義を追い謀殺するが、南朝はこの機会に京と鎌倉を同時奪還する軍事的進攻を行い、北朝神器の接収、北朝の光厳・光明・崇光天皇三上皇と皇太子直仁親王の拉致を行い一統は破談となる。
sen.e: Takauji catches Takayoshi in Kamakura and kills him, but the Southern Dynasty uses this chance for military action to grab both Kyoto and Kamakura back, get the Northern Dynasty Sacred Treasures, and kidnap the three retired Emperors Kogon, Komyo, Suko and the Crown Prince Naohito of the Northern Dynasty, leading to peace talks being broken off.

Takauji caught Takayoshi in Kamakura and killed him, but the Southern Dynasty used this chance for military action to grab both Kyoto and Kamakura back, get the Northern Dynasty Sacred Treasures, and kidnap the three retired Emperors Kogon, Komyo, Suko and the Crown Prince Naohito of the Northern Dynasty, which led to peace talks being broken off.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。（時制）
sen.e: Takauji caught Takayoshi in Kamakura and killed him, but the Southern Court used this chance for military action to grab both Kyoto and Kamakura back, get the Northern Court Sacred Treasures, and kidnap the three retired Emperors Kogon, Komyo, Suko and the Crown Prince Naohito of the Northern Court, which led to peace talks being broken off.

sen.j: 京と鎌倉は足利方に奪還され、北朝は神器と治天が不在であったが後光厳の践祚により再建される。
sen.e: Kyoto and Kamakura are returned to the Ashikaga side, and although the Sacred Treasures and Chiten (ruling emperor) were absent, the Northern Dynasty was re-established by the ascension of Gokogen.
Kyoto and Kamakura returned to the Ashikaga side, and although the Sacred Treasures and Chiten (ruling emperor) were absent, the Northern Dynasty was re-established by the ascension of Gokogen.
Kyoto and Kamakura returned to the Ashikaga side, and although the Sacred Treasures and Chiten (ruling emperor) were absent, the Northern Court was re-established by the ascension of Gokogen.

tit.j: 後村上天皇時代と南朝衰退
tit.e: Retired Emperor Gomurakami Period and the Decline of the Southern Dynasty
The Period of Retired Emperor Gomurakami and the Decline of the Southern Dynasty
The Period of Retired Emperor Gomurakami and the Decline of the Southern Court

sen.j: この頃、九州において少弐氏に擁立されていた足利直冬は九州から駆逐され、同年11月に南朝に属して尊氏に抵抗する。
sen.e: Around this time, Tadafuyu ASHIKAGAWA, who was being protected by the Shoni clan, was chased out of Kyushu and in November of the same year, he joined the Southern Dynasty and rebelled against Takauji.

Around this time, Tadafuyu ASHIKAGAWA, who was being protected by the Shoni clan, was chased out of Kyushu and in November of the same year, he joined the Southern Dynasty and rebelled against Takauji.
Around this time, Tadafuyu ASHIKAGAWA, who was being protected by the Shoni clan, was chased out of Kyushu and in November of the same year, he joined the Southern Court and rebelled against Takauji.

sen.j: 1353年（正平8年/文和2年）には楠木正儀、山名時氏らが二度目の京都奪還を果たすも短期間で駆逐される。
sen.e: In 1353, Masanori KUSUNOKI and Tokiuji YAMANA succeeded in recoving Kyoto for the second time, but were chased away in a short time.
In 1353, Masanori KUSUNOKI and Tokiuji YAMANA succeeded in recovering Kyoto for the second time, but were chased away after a short time.
In 1353, Masanori KUSUNOKI and Tokiuji YAMANA succeeded in recovering Kyoto for the second time, but were chased away after a short time.

sen.j: 翌1354年、4月には主導的人物であった北畠親房が死去、10月に後村上天皇は賀名生から河内金剛寺 (河内長野市)へ移る。
sen.e: The next year in April 1354, Chikahusa KITABATAKE, who was a core person, died and Emperor Gomurakami transferred from Ano to Kongo-ji Temple in Kawachi Province (Kawachinagano City).
The next year in April 1354, Chikahusa KITABATAKE, who was a core person, died and Emperor Gomurakami transferred from Ano to Kongo-ji Temple in Kawachi Province (Kawachinagano City).
The next year in April 1354, Chikahusa KITABATAKE, who was a core person, died and Emperor Gomurakami transferred from Ano to Kongo-ji Temple in Kawachi Province (Kawachinagano City) in October.

sen.j: 1355年（正平10年/文和4年）にも直冬を奉じた山名時氏らが京都侵攻を行うが、維持出来ずに撤退している。
sen.e: In 1355, Tokuiuji YAMANA with Tadafuyu tried to attack Kyoto, but could not maintain forces and had to retreat.
In 1355, Tokuiuji YAMANA tried to attack Kyoto with Tadafuyu, but could not maintain his attack and had to retreat.
In 1355, Tokuiuji YAMANA tried to attack Kyoto with Tadafuyu, but could not maintain his attack and had to retreat.

sen.j: 1358年（正平13年/延文3年）に北朝では足利尊氏が死去し、2代将軍となった足利義詮は本格的な南朝掃討をはじめる。
sen.e: Regarding the Northern Dynasty, Takuji ASHIKAGA died in 1358 and the second shogun, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA started a serious mopping up of the Southern Dynasty.
Regarding the Northern Dynasty, Takuji ASHIKAGA died in 1358 and the second shogun, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA started a serious mopping up of the Southern Dynasty.
Regarding the Northern Court, Takuji ASHIKAGA died in 1358 and the second shogun, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA started a serious mopping up of the Southern Court.

sen.j: 1361年（正平16年/康安元年）には足利政権において政争から失脚した執事の細川清氏が南朝に属し、楠木正儀らと4度目の京都侵攻を行い、一時的に占領する。
sen.e: In 1361, the chamberlain Kiyouji HOSOKAWA, who had lost power within the Ashikaga government, joined the Southern Dynasty and tried the fourth attack on Kyoto together with Masanori KUSUNOKI, and occupied the city for a while.

In 1361, the chamberlain Kiyouji HOSOKAWA, who had lost power within the Ashikaga government, joined the Southern Dynasty and tried the fourth attack on Kyoto together with Masanori KUSUNOKI, and occupied the city for a while.

In 1361, the chamberlain Kiyouji HOSOKAWA, who had lost power within the Ashikaga government, joined the Southern Court and tried the fourth attack on Kyoto together with Masanori KUSUNOKI, and occupied the city for a while.

sen.j: その後、後村上天皇が摂津国の住吉大社宮司の津守氏の正印殿を約10年間、行宮（住吉行宮）とし、住吉大神を奉じる瀬戸内海の水軍を傘下にして、四国、九州との連絡網を確立し、南朝は各地で活動するが、1363年には山名氏や大内氏の北朝への帰順、楠木正儀の投降などで衰退し、拉致した三上皇を返還するなど講和的態度も示している。
sen.e: Afterwards, Emperor Gomurakami made the Shoinden (main shrine building) of the Tsumori clan, who were hereditary chief priests of the Sumiyoshi-taisha Grand Shrine in Settsu Province, his Angu (Sumiyoshi Angu), or temporary lodging especially for an Imperial visit, for about ten years and established a contact route with Shikokua dn Kyushu because he held the naval forces in the Seto Inland Sea, who worshiped the Sumiyoshi Gods, leading to activities of the Southern Dynasty in various places, but the betrayal of the Yamana clan and Ouchi clan to the Northern Dynasty and the surrender of Masanori KUSUNOKI led to its decline and it started to show a stance towards peace by returning the three retired emperors.

Afterwards, Emperor Gomurakami made the Shoinden (main shrine building) of the Tsumori clan, who were hereditary chief priests of the Sumiyoshi-taisha Grand Shrine in Settsu Province, his Angu (Sumiyoshi Angu), or temporary lodging especially for an Imperial visit, for about ten years and established a contact route with Shikokua and Kyushu because he held control of the naval forces in the Seto Inland Sea, who worshiped the Sumiyoshi Gods, leading to activities of the Southern Dynasty in various places, but the betrayal of the Yamana clan and Ouchi clan to the Northern Dynasty and the surrender of Masanori KUSUNOKI led to its decline and it started to show a shift towards a peaceful stance by returning the three retired emperors.

Afterwards, Emperor Gomurakami made the Shoinden (main shrine building) of the Tsumori clan, who were hereditary chief priests of the Sumiyoshi-taisha Grand Shrine in Settsu Province, his Angu (Sumiyoshi Angu), or temporary lodging especially for an Imperial visit, for about ten years and established a contact route with Shikokua and Kyushu because he held control of the naval forces in the Seto Inland Sea, who worshiped the Sumiyoshi Gods, leading to activities of the Southern Court in various places, but the betrayal of the Yamana clan and Ouchi clan to the Northern Court and the surrender of Masanori KUSUNOKI in 1363 led to its decline and it started to show a shift towards a peaceful stance by returning the three retired emperors.
sen.cmt: DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。in 1363を追記しました。

tit.j: 長慶天皇と南朝の後退
tit.e: Decline of Emperor Chokei and the Southern Dynasty
The Decline of Emperor Chokei and the Southern Dynasty
The Decline of Emperor Chokei and the Southern Court

sen.j: 1368年（正平23年/応安元年）には後村上天皇が住吉行宮で死去し、同地にて長慶天皇が即位する。
sen.e: In 1368, Emperor Gomurakami died at the Sumiyoshi Angu and Emperor Chokei ascended the throne at the Angu.
In 1368, Emperor Gomurakami died at the Sumiyoshi Angu and Emperor Chokei ascended the throne at the Angu.
In 1368, Emperor Gomurakami died at the Sumiyoshi Angu and Emperor Chokei ascended the throne at the Angu.

sen.j: 足利政権では有力守護の佐々木道誉、3代将軍の足利義満のもとで管領を務めた細川頼之などが南朝の楠木正儀と独自に交渉を行っていたが、長慶天皇は北朝に対して強硬的な人物であったと考えられており、和睦交渉は一時途絶し、翌1369年（正平23年/応安2年）に正儀は北朝へ投降する。
sen.e: The prominent provincial constabler, Doyo SASAKI and Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA who was regent of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA and others of the Ashikaga government had independent negotiations with Masanori KUSUNOKI of the Southern Dynasty, but Emperor Chokei took a strong stance towards the Northern Dynasty, leading to a break off in peace negotiations, and in 1369, Masanori surrenders to the Northern Dynasty.

The prominent provincial constable, Doyo SASAKI, and Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA who was the regent of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, and other members of the Ashikaga government held independent negotiations with Masanori KUSUNOKI of the Southern Dynasty, but Emperor Chokei took a strong stance towards the Northern Dynasty, leading to a break down in the peace negotiations, and in 1369, Masanori surrendered to the Northern Dynasty.

The prominent provincial constable, Doyo SASAKI, and Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA who was the regent of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA (third shogun), and other members of the Ashikaga government held independent negotiations with Masanori KUSUNOKI of the Southern Court, but Emperor Chokei took a strong stance towards the Northern Court, leading to a break down in the peace negotiations, and in 1369, Masanori surrendered to the Northern Court.
sen.cmt: DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。三代将軍を追加しました。

sen.j: 南朝の征西府懐良親王も菊池氏や阿蘇氏、筑後宇都宮氏の武力を背景に大宰府を有して九州を制圧していたが、九州探題として赴任した今川貞世（了俊）に駆逐される。
sen.e: The Southern Dynasty Seiseifu (Conqueror of the west) Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi held Dazaifu and controlled Kyushu using the military forces of the Kikuchi clan, the Aso clan and the Chikugo Utsunomiya clan, but was chased away by Sadoyo IMAGAWA (Ryoshun) who came as the Kyushu Tandai.

The Southern Dynasty Seiseifu (Conqueror of the west) Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi held Dazaifu and controlled Kyushu using the military forces of the Kikuchi clan, the Aso clan and the Chikugo Utsunomiya clan, but was chased away by Sadoyo IMAGAWA (Ryoshun) who came as the Kyushu Tandai.

The Southern Court Seiseifu (Conqueror of the west) Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi held Dazaifu and controlled Kyushu using the military forces of the Kikuchi clan, the Aso clan and the Chikugo-Utsunomiya clan, but was chased away by Sadoyo IMAGAWA (Ryoshun) who came as the Kyushu Tandai.
sen.cmt: DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。ハイフン補足。

sen.j: その後交渉が再開され、南朝の使者が京都へ赴いている。
sen.e: Negotiations were resumed afterwards and a messenger from the Southern Dynasty visited Kyoto.
Negotiations were resumed afterwards and a messenger from the Southern Dynasty visited Kyoto.
Negotiations were resumed afterwards and a messenger from the Southern Court visited Kyoto.

sen.j: 1383年（弘和3年/永徳3年）に長慶天皇は弟の後亀山天皇に譲位する。
sen.e: In 1383, Emperor Chokei abdicated from the throne in favor of his younger brother, Emperor Gokameyama.
In 1383, Emperor Chokei abdicated from the throne in favor of his younger brother, Emperor Gokameyama.
In 1383, Emperor Chokei abdicated from the throne in favor of his younger brother, Emperor Gokameyama.

sen.j: なお、長慶天皇は即位していないという説もある。
sen.e: There is also a hypothesis that Emperor Chokei had never officially ascended the throne.
There is also a hypothesis that Emperor Chokei had never officially ascended the throne.
There is also a hypothesis that Emperor Chokei had never officially ascended the throne.

tit.e: Unification of the Southern and Northern Dynasties
The Unification of the Southern and Northern Dynasties
The Unification of the Southern and Northern Courts

sen.j: 1391年（元中8年/明徳2年）の明徳の乱で有力守護の山名氏を弱体化させ、武家勢力を統率した義満は、和泉国・紀伊国の守護で南朝と領地を接する大内義弘の仲介で本格的交渉を開始する。
sen.e: The Meitoku Rebellion in 1391weakened the prominent provincial constable Yamana clan, and with the samurai families united under Yoshimitsu, he had Yoshihiro OUCHI, who was the provincial constable of Isumi and Kii Provinces and whose property lay next to the Southern Dynasty, to intervene and start serious negotiations.

The Meitoku Rebellion in 1391 weakened the prominent provincial constable Yamana's clan, and with the samurai families united under Yoshimitsu, he had Yoshihiro OUCHI, who was the provincial constable of Isumi and Kii Provinces and whose property lay next to the Southern Dynasty, to intervene and start serious negotiations.

The Meitoku Rebellion in 1391 weakened the prominent provincial constable Yamana's clan, and with the samurai families united under Yoshimitsu, he had Yoshihiro OUCHI, who was the provincial constable of Isumi and Kii Provinces and whose property lay next to the Southern Court, to intervene and start serious negotiations.

sen.j: 南朝から北朝への神器の引渡し、国衙領を大覚寺統、長講堂領を持明院統の領地とする事、皇位は両統迭立とする事など3か条を条件に和睦が成立。
sen.e: Three conditions: the return of the Sacred Treasures from the Southern Dynasty, Kokuga property to be owned by the Daikaku-ji Temple line and Chokodo property to be Jimyo-in line's property, and the throne to be passed back and forth as Ryoto Tetsuritsu, established peace and in 1392, Emperor Gokameyama traveled to Kyoto to give the Sacred Treasures to Emperor Gokomatsu and an unified southern and Northern Dynasty was established by the termination of the southern Dynasty.

There were three conditions: the return of the Sacred Treasures from the Southern Dynasty, Kokuga property to be controlled by the Daikaku-ji Temple line and Chokodo property to become the Jimyo-in line's property, and the throne to be passed back and forth as Ryoto Tetsuritsu. This established peace and in 1392, Emperor Gokameyama traveled to Kyoto to give the Sacred Treasures to Emperor Gokomatsu and a unified Southern and Northern Dynasty was established with the termination of the southern Dynasty.

There were three conditions: the return of the Sacred Treasures from the Southern Court, Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office) to be controlled by the Daikakuji line and Chokodo property to become the Jimyoin line's property, and the throne to be passed back and forth as Ryoto Tetsuritsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。国衙領→Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office)としました。ハイフン削除。Temple削除。

sen.j: 1392年（元中9年/明徳3年）に後亀山天皇は京都へ赴いて後小松天皇に神器を譲渡し、南朝が解消される形で南北朝合一は成立した（明徳の和約）。
sen.e: This established peace and in 1392, Emperor Gokameyama traveled to Kyoto to give the Sacred Treasures to Emperor Gokomatsu and a unified Southern and Northern Court was established with the termination of the Southern Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。Southern大文字にしました。

sen.j: 南朝に属していた公家は一部は北朝で任官したが、官職は既に北朝の公家で占められており、多くは公家社会への復帰が適わなかったと考えられている。
sen.e: Some court nobles who were affiliated with the Southern Dynasty were able to be appointed again, but the majority of positions were already taken by Northern Dynasty court nobles and it is thought that many could not return to the court society.

Some court nobles who were affiliated with the Southern Dynasty were able to be appointed again, but the majority of positions were already taken by Northern Dynasty court nobles and it is thought that many could not return to the court society.

Some court nobles who were affiliated with the Southern Court were able to be appointed again, but the majority of positions were already taken by the court nobles of Northern Court and it is thought that many could not return to the court society.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理DynastyをCourtに訂正しました。表現を変更しました→the court nobles of Northern Court

tit.e: Go-nancho
Post Southern Dynasty
tit.cmt: 表現を変更しました。「南朝」をSouthern Dynastyに統一すべきではないでしょうか？
tit.e: Post Southern Court

sen.j: 後の1412年（応永19年）には後小松皇子の称光天皇が即位しており、両統迭立の条件は反故にされている。
sen.e: Later, in 1412, Gokomatsu's son, Emperor Shoko ascended the throne and the conditions for Ryoto Tetsuritsu were broken.
Later, in 1412, Gokomatsu's son, Emperor Shoko ascended the throne and the conditions for Ryoto Tetsuritsu were broken.
Later, in 1412, Gokomatsu's son, Emperor Shoko ascended the throne and the conditions for Ryoto Tetsuritsu were broken.

sen.j: これに反発した南朝の後胤や遺臣らは、朝廷や幕府に対する反抗を15世紀半ばまで続けた。
sen.e: This led to a rebellion amongst descendants and former court nobles of the Southern Dynasty, and they resisted against the court and bakufu until mid-15th century.
This led to a rebellion amongst descendants and former court nobles of the Southern Dynasty, and their resistance against the court and bakufu lasted until the mid-15th century.
This led to a rebellion amongst descendants and former court nobles of the Southern Court, and their resistance against the court and bakufu lasted until the mid-15th century.

sen.j: これを後南朝という。
sen.e: This is called the further Southern Dynasty.
This is called post Southern Dynasty.
This is called post Southern Court.
